sect2.title: Translating
sect2.para: The translation files are in the po directory. Go to the po directory:
The xiphos.pot file contains the strings to be located. Update the pot file:

Copy the xiphos.pot file to YOUR-LANG.po file: YOUR-LANG = LL_CC combination. Here 'LL' is an ISO 639 two-letter language code, and 'CC' is an ISO 3166 two-letter country code. 'LL_CC' combinations can be abbreviated as 'LL' to denote the language's main dialect. For example, let's suppose that you speak Portuguese, pt_BR.po is the name of YOUR-LANG.po file if you live in Brazil, but pt.po if you live in Portugual.
Add YOUR-LANG to the LINGUAS file:
Edit the file manually (emacs, vi, gedit) or with one of the available programs for this (gtranslator, poedit, emacs po mode...), creating the translation:
Check the file for errors (IMPORTANT! Don't forget this step):
Update the .po file from the latest source code
Or update it from the .pot file
Compile the translation (you will probably have to be root to do this)
/usr/share/locales should be changed to whereever your prefix is for building Xiphos (eg, /usr/local/share/locales by default).
